avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last few days sometimes large wind slabs formed in all aspects. Even single backcountry tourers can release avalanches. In some places avalanches can also penetrate down to the ground and reach large size in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation. The avalanche prone locations are to be found on steep slopes and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. As a consequence of warming, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase gradually. In the event of rain this applies in particular.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger. The danger of moist and wet avalanches is close to the boundary with danger level 4 (high).

snowpackStructure.comment: As a consequence of sharply rising temperatures and rain up to high altitudes the snowpack can not consolidate. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in particular on northwest to east to south facing aspects. Snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind. Below the tree line only a little snow is lying.

tendency.comment: As a consequence of warming, the likelihood of moist snow slides and avalanches being released will increase further. Up to intermediate altitudes rain will fall.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last few days sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed on north, east and southeast facing slopes. These are to be avoided above approximately 2300 m. Even single backcountry tourers can release avalanches in some places, including medium-sized ones. The avalanche prone locations are to be found on steep slopes and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Wet avalanches during the day are possible. They can also be triggered in the old snowpack and reach quite a large size. The current avalanche situation calls for defensive route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger, especially along the border with France. In the evening as a consequence of the rain there will be an increase in the avalanche danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: As a consequence of sharply rising temperatures and rain up to high altitudes the snowpack can not consolidate. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in particular on northwest to east to south facing aspects. Snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind. Below the tree line only a little snow is lying.

tendency.comment: As a consequence of warming, the likelihood of moist snow slides and avalanches being released will increase further. Up to intermediate altitudes rain will fall.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last few days sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed in high Alpine regions. The fresh snow and the mostly small wind slabs can still be released in some cases especially on north to east to southeast facing aspects above approximately 2400 m. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are to be avoided in particular in very steep terrain.
In some places new snow is lying on an icy crust. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
Slight increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger, especially along the border with France. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming there will be only a slight increase in the danger of dry and moist avalanches.

snowpackStructure.comment: In all altitude zones less snow than usual is lying. Below approximately 2200 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. Snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. The snowpack is largely stable and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a strong melt-freeze crust. Towards its base, the snowpack is moist.

tendency.comment: The weather will be very mild. As a consequence of warming, the likelihood of moist snow slides and avalanches being released will increase a little.

avalancheActivity.comment: The mostly small wind slabs of the last few days can be released in isolated cases on extremely steep shady slopes and generally in high Alpine regions. In particular in high Alpine regions these avalanche prone locations are more prevalent. In some places new snow is lying on an icy crust. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls. As the snowfall level rises wet loose snow slides are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: In all altitude zones only a little snow is now lying. The snowpack is largely stable and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a strong crust. The avalanche prone locations are rare.

tendency.comment: As a consequence of warming, the likelihood of moist snow slides and avalanches being released will increase further. Up to intermediate altitudes rain will fall.
